article.headline: Florida International 69, South Alabama 67
article.story: MIAMI (AP) -- Alex Galindo scored 17 of his 24 points in the second half and Chris Fuller's basket with 12 seconds remaining put Florida International ahead for good, as the Golden Panthers beat South Alabama 69-67 on Sunday to end the Jaguars' 13-game winning streak. FIU (11-15, 6-10 Sun Belt) trailed by 16 points with 19:15 to play, before rallying to end what was the second-longest current winning streak in the nation. Michael James had 14 points and Fuller finished with 10 for FIU, which forced South Alabama into a season-high 20 turnovers. The Golden Panthers got 24 points off those turnovers. Demetric Bennett had 22 points for South Alabama, which lost despite shooting 55 percent for the game and 65 percent in the second half. Daon Merritt added 16 points on 6-for-7 shooting for the Jaguars (20-8, 13-3).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
